verses.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, \add even\add* the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal.
Surely I \add am\add* more brutish than \add any\add* man, And have not the understanding of a man.
I neither learned wisdom, Nor have the knowledge of the holy.

Who hath ascended up \add into\add* heaven, or descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound the waters in a garment? Who hath established all the ends of the earth? What \add is\add* his name, and what \add is\add* his son’s name, if thou canst tell?
Every word of God \add is\add* pure: He \add is\add* a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
Add thou not unto his words, Lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
Two \add things\add* have I required of thee; Deny me \add them\add* not before I die:
Remove far from me vanity and lies: Give me neither poverty nor riches; Feed me with food convenient for me:
Lest I be full, and deny \add thee\add*, And say, Who \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc*? Or lest I be poor, and steal, And take the name of my God \add in vain\add*.
Accuse not a servant unto his master, Lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that\add* curseth their father, And doth not bless their mother.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that are\add* pure in their own eyes, And \add yet\add* is not washed from their filthiness.
\add There is\add* a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! And their eyelids are lifted up.
\add There is\add* a generation, whose teeth \add are as\add* swords, And their jaw teeth \add as\add* knives, To devour the poor from off the earth, And the needy from \add among\add* men.
The horseleach hath two daughters, \add crying\add*, Give, give. There are three \add things that\add* are never satisfied, \add Yea\add*, four \add things\add* say not, \add It is\add* enough:
The grave; and the barren womb; The earth \add that\add* is not filled \add with\add* water; And the fire \add that\add* saith not, \add It is\add* enough.
The eye \add that\add* mocketh at \add his\add* father, And despiseth to obey \add his\add* mother, The ravens of the valley shall pick it out, And the young eagles shall eat it.
There be three \add things which\add* are too wonderful for me, Yea, four which I know not:
The way of an eagle in the air; The way of a serpent upon a rock; The way of a ship in the midst of the sea; And the way of a man with a maid.
Such \add is\add* the way of an adulterous woman; She eateth, and wipeth her mouth, And saith, I have done no wickedness.
For three \add things\add* the earth is disquieted, And for four \add which\add* it cannot bear:
For a servant when he reigneth; And a fool when he is filled \add with\add* meat;
For an odious \add woman\add* when she is married; And a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
There be four \add things which are\add* little upon the earth, But they \add are\add* exceeding wise:
The ants \add are\add* a people not strong, Yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
The conies \add are but\add* a feeble folk, Yet make they their houses in the rocks;
The locusts have no king, Yet go they forth all of them by bands;
The spider taketh hold with her hands, And \add is\add* in kings’ palaces.
There be three \add things\add* which go well, Yea, four are comely in going:
A lion \add which is\add* strongest among beasts, And turneth not away for any;
A greyhound; a he goat also; And a king, against whom \add there is\add* no rising up.
If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, Or if thou hast thought evil, \add Lay thine\add* hand upon thy mouth.
Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, And the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: So the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
